---
title: "oidc_missing_redirect_address.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file contains configuration settings for authentication in a system, specifically focusing on OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication. It defines the authentication requirements, session settings, and OIDC provider details.

## Symbols

### `authentication`
#### Description
The root configuration object for authentication settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets authentication as required
- Defines session settings
- Specifies authentication methods, focusing on OIDC

### `authentication.required`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether authentication is mandatory for the system.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| required | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that authentication is required |

### `authentication.session`
#### Description
Configures session-related settings for the authentication process.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the session domain to "http://localhost:8080"
- Disables secure sessions

### `authentication.session.domain`
#### Description
Specifies the domain for which the session is valid.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| domain | string | Set to "http://localhost:8080", indicating the session is valid for localhost on port 8080 |

### `authentication.session.secure`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether secure sessions should be used.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| secure | boolean | Set to `false`, indicating that secure sessions are not enabled |

### `authentication.methods`
#### Description
Defines the authentication methods available in the system.

#### Internal Logic
- Currently only includes OIDC as an authentication method

### `authentication.methods.oidc`
#### Description
Configures the OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication method.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables OIDC authentication
- Defines a single OIDC provider named "foo"

### `authentication.methods.oidc.enabled`
#### Description
A boolean flag indicating whether OIDC authentication is enabled.

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| enabled | boolean | Set to `true`, indicating that OIDC authentication is enabled |

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers`
#### Description
Defines the OIDC providers available for authentication.

#### Internal Logic
- Currently includes a single provider named "foo"

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo`
#### Description
Configures the OIDC provider named "foo".

#### Internal Logic
- Sets the client ID and client secret for the provider
- Specifies the required scopes for authentication

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.client_id`
#### Description
The client ID for the OIDC provider "foo".

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| client_id | string | Set to "client_id" (Note: This is likely a placeholder and should be replaced with an actual client ID) |

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.client_secret`
#### Description
The client secret for the OIDC provider "foo".

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| client_secret | string | Set to "client_secret" (Note: This is likely a placeholder and should be replaced with an actual client secret) |

### `authentication.methods.oidc.providers.foo.scopes`
#### Description
An array of scopes requested during the OIDC authentication process for provider "foo".

#### Outputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| scopes | array of strings | Contains a single scope: "user:email" |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Indicates whether authentication is mandatory |
| authentication.session.domain | string | "http://localhost:8080" | The domain for which the session is valid |
| authentication.session.secure | boolean | false | Indicates whether secure sessions are enabled |
| authentication.methods.oidc.enabled | boolean | true | Indicates whether OIDC authentication is enabled |

## TODOs
The filename "oidc_missing_redirect_address.yml" suggests that there might be a missing redirect address configuration for the OIDC provider. This is an important setting for OIDC authentication and should be added to the configuration file.
